Following their first training session in Paris, the Poles now wait for their last rival
On Friday, the Polish volleyball team had their first training session in Paris, where on Saturday they will play in the bronze medal match.
The path to the title was blocked for Vital Heynen’s charges owing to their 1-3 defeat on Thursday against the Slovenians in Ljubljana.
There have been a lot of media reports about their troubles travelling to this clash.
This time, there were no such problems – on Friday morning they used a charter and went with the Slovenians to Paris and a few hours later they took training in the famous Bercy Arena.
According to onlookers, the World Champions’ coach appeared flustered.
As Heynen’s assistant Michał Mieszko Gogol pointed out, this time the main purpose of training was not just about practising volleyball techniques.
"We went to the arena but it was mostly about providing time for the team.
It was about spending that time together rather than training.
To talk and think about how we will rebuild it all as a team," he reported.
He confirmed that the semi-final defeat was a hard lesson for both players and coaching staff.
"We were brutally brought down to earth.
We’re disappointed, there’s no doubt about it.
We still believed we would go back to that match.
We discussed the match amongst the staff, and the coach talked a lot with the players.
I would suggest that the two main reasons for our defeat were the ineffectiveness of the attack line and coping with situational balls much poorer than usual.
In this respect, the Slovenians were much better than us," he said.
In his view, the White and Reds had not been under stress due to being up against the tournament co-host, in front of a large, noisy support.
He admitted that the smooth path to the semi-finals could have allowed the World Champions’ to let their guard down.
"Probably, if we had been defeated in a similar way in the group phase, we would have learnt that lesson quicker, and later on we would have played differently in the later stages of the tournament.
But these are what-ifs," he reserved.
Gogol hopes that anger due to Thursday’s defeat will morph into aggression during the Bronze medal match.
"I hope we will show our true colours then.
The stakes are high.
The last time we won the medal during the European Championship was back in 2011," he recalled.
Paris is the fifth city, and France the third country visited by the Poles during this championship.
In the group phase they competed in Rotterdam and Amsterdam, then went to Apeldoorn for the first two meetings of the group phase, before moving on to Ljubljana for the semi-final.
Nick Kyrgios: a harsh but suspended punishment
The Australian tennis player was given a 16-week ban – suspended for six months – and a fine of 25,000 dollars for the use of reprehensible words, gestures and deeds during the last ATP tournament.
ATP World Tour members have lost patience for Kyrgios, but they will give him a chance to improve.

The summary of transgressions given against one of the most controversial professional tennis players of recent years reads menacingly – a 16-week ban and a substantial fine, with both having been suspended for six months – a probation period during which the recalcitrant athlete can improve his behaviour.

Nick Kyrgios is just 24 years old but he has been courting controversy for a very long time, beating a tennis world record by having had to pay the highest single financial penalty in the history of the sport for breaking rules of conduct both on and off the court.

Loud swearing, strange gestures, unsportsmanlike conduct, insulting a judge and the audience, breaking two rackets during a defeat against Karen Khachanov – all rule breaches for which he paid 113,000 dollars following August’s ATP Masters 1000 tournaments in Cincinnati.

Despite an early exit at the 2019 US Open, he still had time to state publicly that ATP members "are corrupt", which offended the organisation so much that they implemented a weeks-long disciplinary investigation into Kyrgios, which later issued a suspension and another fine.
However, after hearing from the accused and being provided with the context around the statement, the words were forgiven.

In a statement, tennis officials claimed that the investigation showed that Kyrgios’ behaviour in the past 12 months was in many cases highly questionable and was in almost constant violation of the rules; he continuously vulgarly insulted people associated with tournaments and spectators, hence the high penalty.

However, the ATP gave him five days to appeal and immediately postponed execution of the sentence, ordering him to meet several conditions during the following six months: during the ATP Tour, and ATP Challenge Tour tournaments Kyrgios may no longer in any way violate the professional tennis players’ code of conduct, particularly he may not swear, destroy rackets, quarrel with judges or the audience, or otherwise behave obscenely or vulgarly.

He was also advised to seek "continuous support" from mental coaches during tournaments but also to consult in the off-season with experts specialising in solving the problems of athletes who can’t cope with their behaviour.
Nick Kyrgios’s first comment (in the social media) on the verdict was as follows: "Hi everybody, I can still play.
I just have to control my behaviour, that's all".

In practice, the Australian will have at least a two-week break, because during The Laver Cup he exacerbated a shoulder injury which forced him to withdraw from ties in Beijing (from 30 September to 6 October) and in Shanghai (from 6 to 13 October).
Kyrgios is in 27th place in the ATP rankings.
This year, he won two tournaments: in Washington and Acapulco, earning more than 1.3 M dollars, so even after paying fines, he will have a lot left.
Central Statistical Office: level of life in Poland constantly rising

According to the report on the household budget that was published by the Central Statistical Office on Friday, as many as 44 percent of households regard their financial situation as good or rather good.

A year ago it was 37,2 percent, in 2016 33,5 percent and earlier, from 2009 onwards, when the statistical office first conducted a survey on the subjective evaluation of the situation in the households it was never higher than 30 percent.
Last year 8,1 percent of households regarded their financial situation as bad or rather bad, in comparison to 11,2 percent a year before and more than 20 percent in 2009.
It is freelancers who have the best financial situation.
More than 70 percent of survey participants perceive it as good or rather good.
As opposed to that only 18 percent of pensioners responded in this manner.
The subjective evaluation of the financial situation is merely influenced by the number of children.
It is lone parents who are living in harsh conditions, 32 percent of them perceive their financial situation as good or rather good.
Among the pairs with children this number is, depending on the number of kids, between 55 and 60 percent, in case of households without children it amounts to 48,8 percent.
The effect of the 500+ programme is merely reflected in those statistics.
Before it was started (in 2016) it was lonely parents and large families (with the minimum of three children) who perceived their financial situation as the worst.
Improving the subjective evaluation of the financial situation of Poles can be attributed to the quick growth of incomes, chiefly from work.
It is, however, not everything, because the number of households that perceive their situation as good is growing faster than real incomes.
What is more, on the level of voivodeships there is no exact correlation between the level of income and the evaluation of the financial situation in households.
The citizens of the Opole voivodeship are the most satisfied, 48,9 percent of the survey recipients think their situation is good or rather good.

The citizens of the Lubuskie voivodeship (47,7 percent) are next, followed by the Silesian voivodeship (47,6 percent), Masovia voivodeship (47,3 percent) and the Western Pomerania voivodeship (47,1 percent).

In the Opole voivodeship the disposable income (after paying taxes and contributions) amounted last year to nearly 94 percent of the average country income, and in the Lubuskie voivodeship to 98 percent.
The citizens of the Masovia voivodeship (120 percent of the average country income) and the Silesia voivodeship (104 percent) were the ones with the highest income.
In 2018 the average disposable income per person amounted to 1693 PLN.
In the real context (after considering the price change) it grew by 4,3 percent as compared to 2017.
In comparison to the earlier years it was quite a low result.
In 2016 the income per person grew by 7 percent and one year later by 6,3 percent.
Even though the growth of incomes is slowing down, it is also the growth of spendings that is decelerating.
Last year they amounted to 1187 zł per capita, so they decreased by 0,7 percent in a real context.
It is the first such a case from 2013.
In 2017 the spendings per person grew realistically by 1,9 per cent and in 2016 by 4,3 per cent.

As the surveys on the household budget suggest, an average household is currently spending 70,1 percent of their disposable incomes. In 2014 this contribution was more than 80 percent and until 2006 more than 90 percent.
Paulina Smaszcz-Kurzajewska in a see-through blouse
Paulina Smaszcz-Kurzajewska appeared on a closed fashion show for Patrizia Pepe brand.
Unfortunately, her look was not a good one.
Paulina Smaszcz-Kurzajewska is the wife of Maciej Kurzajewski, a sports journalist.
Paulina Smaszcz-Kurzajewska is a Polish journalist and television presenter.
She is involved in activities in favour of women, for whom she organises interactive workshops, motivational speeches, lectures and conference panels.
For 25 years she has been working in the public relations industry with companies such as PZU, Red Bull, and Bayer.
As a journalist, she has worked with TVP1, TVN Style, Wizja Sport, and TVP2.
She is author of the book "Mama i tata to my", in which she talks about the health, development and nutrition of children aged 0 to 3 years old.
She was involved in many projects aimed at supporting professionally active women.
The initiatives she manages include "Network of Entrepreneurial Women", "Business Women's Box", "The Congress of Women Association", and "Make Up Buisness".
In her private life, she is the wife of Maciej Kurzajewski – television presenter and sports journalist.
The married couple have two sons: Franciszek and Julian.
Paulina Smaszcz-Kurzajewska appeared on a closed fashion show for the Italian brand Patrizia Pepe.
The event was also attended by Natasza Urbańska, Katarzyna Figura, and Beata Chmielowska-Olech.
The intimate fashion show couldn’t take place without a wall, where stars showed off their outfits.
Unfortunately, photojournalists picked up on Paulina Smaszcz-Kurzajewska’s unfortunate mistake.
She wore a black blouse with a white bra visible underneath.
USA: Three suicides among aircraft carrier crew
Three sailors committed suicide aboard the USS George H. W. Bush ship last week, informed the American Navy.
A total of five crew members of this ship committed suicide in the last two years.
The previous suicide occurred in July this year, with the previous one taking place in November 2017.
According to CNN, all three sailors shot themselves last week.
Each incident occurred on land when the USS George H. W. Bush moored at the coast of Virginia.
Third party involvement has been ruled out as of yet.
Moreover, the deaths are said to have been unrelated.
"We need all hands to engage by bringing forward your suggestions and ideas for how we can work together to prevent another suicide.
I want to reiterate that there is never any stigma or repercussion from seeking help", wrote Captain Sean Bailey, the ship’s commanding officer.
Niesiołowski critically about the Pope.
John Paul II didn't do anything
In a talk with Piotr Lekszycki Stefan Niesiołowski emphasised that in 1981 John Paul II was a huge authority for opposition activists.
"Any sentence of his was actually accepted".
Later criticism of some of his actions was to appear.
"For me the fact that John Paul II was unable to get rid of the harmful Rydzyk’s activity seriously overshadowed his pontificate.
After all, this redemptorist – a pest devastating the Church and Poland – developed his media in full swing already when the Polish Pope was alive," he kept explaining.

The former PO politician admitted: "there were some murmurs of discontent, the pope said something, he did not receive Rydzyk once, but was in authority and could have just thrown him out of the Church or sent him to a mission to New Caledonia or Fiji to collect money for the poor.
Unfortunately, John Paul II did not do that, his successors likewise" explained Niesiołowski.
"Besides, there came the disastrous case of paedophilia and the Church operations or their lack, actually.
I looked ahead a bit, but I wanted to attract attention to the whole profile of his life.
About the scale of paedophilia in the Church we have found out relatively recently.
A question is: how is it possible that John Paul II, being head of the Church, did not know about those disgusting practices" says Niesiołowski in his talk with a journalist.
In the opinion of former PO politician the Church is a PiS ally.
"It should be admitted that in the Solidarity era the Church was our most important ally.
All celebrations began with a holy mass, crosses were everywhere.
Now the crosses are PiS related, they have become a symbol of dictatorship – the sign of PiS regime.
I repeat: one of the most unpleasant surprises is the fact that such people as Rydzyk keeps a firm grip of the Polish Church, that John Paul II did nothing about it and the Church is a PiS ally.
This is a black chapter of Polish Church to be paid for dearly" kept convincing Niesiołowski.
I hope that Pope Francis will chase out Jędraszewski, Rydzyk and a few other of the sort", he summed up.

PZPN gives away penalties for stadium fights.
Gryf disqualified

There was a close shave away from tragedy during the Cup of Poland clash between Gryf Wejherowo and Lechia Gdańsk when a flare launched by Wejherowo fans passed millilitres away from the opposite team goal keeper, Zlatan Alomerovic.
After the incident the match was interrupted for 20 minutes.
The PZPN (Polish Football Association) commission gave Gryf a severe penalty excluding it from next year’s matches.
The club will not be allowed to take part in the Polish Cup in the 2020/2021 season.
In addition, fans will not be allowed to enter their own stadium in the next match.
They will also be disallowed to make group trips to league matches until 31st December.
Fights at the Widzew Łódź stadium were triggered by Śląsk Wrocław fans.
However, in this case the PZPNs verdict was milder, because Śląsk forewarned that similar events might occur and notified relevant organs about the problems.
In spite of this, the forces did not prevent from throwing flares to the sector of fans from Łódź, burning chairs and attacking the sector of home fans.
This match was interrupted for eight hours, while during the intervention police forces had to use a water cannon.
PZPN punished Śląsk a single stadium ban for the next Polish Cup match and banned to organise match trips in this and next Polish Cup edition.
The ban for group trips covered also the league matches of Extraklasa, however in this case it would last until 31st December.
The names of foreign cities on road signs in Polish language version as well
GDNMR is planning to change all signs in the whole road network until the end of 2020
GDNMR Rzeszów
The implementation of the amendment to the act of the Minister of Infrastructure on, among others, writing the names of foreign cities in the Polish version as well has been started in Subcarpathia.
E. g. "Lwów" will appear near "L'viv".
In our voivodeship the changes will be implemented on 94 road signs near the motorway A4 and national roads: DK19, DK94.
The concept is about making everything easier, more legible and smoother.

The new guidelines can be attributed to the amendment of the act on the specific technical requirements for road signs and signals as well as the traffic safety devices issued by the Minister of Infrastructure.
"We should remember that the city names in the neighbouring countries often have their Polish equivalents.
Thanks to the change in law we prepared they will finally appear on the road signs near our roads.
At first the new signs will be introduced at the Subcarpathian section of the A4 motorway, said Minister of Infrastructure Andrzej Adamczyk.
In the Subcarpathia voivodeship the changes will be implemented on 94 road signs near the motorway A4 and national roads: DK19, DK94.
Total costs of this investment?
PLN 200 thousand
At first, the new signs are going to be implemented at the A4 motorway, which is scheduled to end by 1st November 2019.
How will this idea be implemented?
Replacement of plates will not be necessary, stickers will be enough.
They will replace the current names of the cities will new ones, written in Polish, on the existing signs.
Both names will be written in one line, at first the name in Polish and than the original version in brackets.
This will be a big help for those who don't know the name of the foreign city in the language of the country in which it is located.
Feel the game with Razer Nari Ultimate for Xbox One
Razer announced the Razer Nari Ultimate for Xbox One – the first haptic-powered headset for Xbox One in the world.
HyperSense ensures immersion in games and provides better control over the in-game surroundings.
Razer HyperSense uses haptic solutions developed by Lofelt, a German company specialising in creating advanced haptic technologies that provide realistic touch-based sensations.
HyperSense uses special haptic drivers and intelligent digital signal transforming to generate high resolution touch feedback in real time, allowing for full immersion in each Xbox One game.
The technology recognises sound signals and transforms them into dynamic vibrations, providing the gamers with lifelike experience without having to install additional software.
Thanks to the sense of touch, sound signals may accurately mimic game play.
Razer HyperSense recreates events – from quiet footsteps to huge explosions, precisely capturing all in-game activities.
"Nari Ultimate or Xbox One has been designed to provide gamers with an additional layer of game play.
Thanks to HyperSense, they can be fully immersed in their favourite titles," said Alvin Cheung, Senior Vice President for Razer peripherals.
Swivelling ear cups have been fit with memory foam cushions infused with cooling gel to limit the heat generated during prolonged use.
The retractable microphone features a quick mute button, while the frame has a HyperSense intensity adjuster and a game-chat balance slider – all for easier use.
The self-adjusting headband allows for seamless and accurate accommodation.

Razer Nari Ultimate for Xbox One also features Xbox Wireless, which enables direct connection with the console without the need to use a wireless transmitter and receiver, which allows for easy and quick configuration.
The headset supports Windows Sonic which ensures a more realistic sound.
Initially intended for PC computers, the Razer Nari Ultimate was launched in September 2018.
Thanks to Nari Ultimate for Xbox One, Razer can now offer the award-winning technology to Xbox One fans.
The set has been valued at €219,99.
Someone has shot a swan with an air gun
In a pond in Zameczno, Lower Silesia, residents noticed a swan suffering wing problems.
After catching it and taking it to a vet it turned out that someone used the animal as a shooting target – an air gun pellet was found in its body.
"Information on the injured bird received the Wild Animal Rehabilitation Centre from Nowa Sól.
The report showed that the animal had broken wings.
We went to the site.
It was obvious that there was something wrong with it.
We were quick and precise so as not to do any harm to it and not expose to additional stress.
The swan was caught and took to a vet.
Already the first x-ray revealed that someone used it as a shooting target.
There were pieces of pellets in its body" says Marcin Walasek, chairman of the Malpol managing i.a. the rehabilitation centre.
It will spend winter in the centre.
"The wounds were cleaned, the bird received antibiotics, water access was provided, as well as a safe place in the centre, where he’s going to spend the winter.
We are trying to strengthen it.
For the time being it is unable to fly.
Releasing it now would make it probably incapable of surviving winter" adds Walasek.
The staff after completing swan rehabilitation intend to release it in spring to the very same pond.
The authority of Żukowice community upon receiving the information on the reason for animal’s bad condition intends to notify the public prosecutor’s office about the case.
The event took place in Zameczno.
Gowin: "We need to excite the Polish small trade"

"Efficient taxation of hypermarkets does not solve the problem of small trade, we need to think if the state has any instruments enabling to excite the Polish trade", said the Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of Science and Higher Education, leader of the Agreement party, Jarosław Gowin.

During the discussion in "Sygnały dnia" in the Programme One radio channel, Gowin said the trade was possessed by international chains which impose such low margins on the Polish manufacturers that the Polish companies cannot develop, as a matter of fact.

In response to the comment that this problem is very difficult to combat, the Deputy Prime Minister reminded the Law and Justice government tried to cope with it at the beginning of its term, but "it was opposed by the EC".
"We won in the Court of Justice and I hope that when the United Right wins the next elections and forms a government, we will come back to that topic", he said.
He stressed also that the "efficient taxation of hypermarkets does not solve the Polish problem, i.e. of the small trade".
"It will be necessary to think it over, if the government, the state has any instruments to excite the Polish trade", said Gowin.
In May, the EU government decided the European Commission made a mistake declaring the "supermarket tax" was prohibited state aid.

The Supermarket Tax Act assumed introduction of two sales tax rates: 0.8 per cent for revenue from PLN 17 million to PLN 170 million a month and 1.4 per cent for revenue above PLN 170 million a month.
The tax was to be in force from September 2016.
In September 2016, the EC initiated proceedings concerning the violation of the EU law by Poland.
Brussels claimed then the tax structure may favour smaller shops which may be considered state aid.
Next, it decided the levy was implemented illegally.
It also issued an order to suspend the tax application until its analysis is finished by the officers in Brussels.
Poland did not agree with that stance, but the tax collection was suspended.
The May decision of the EU Court opened up the way to the repeated introduction of the tax, but did not end the case.
On 24 July, the Commission filed an appeal in the Court of Justice.
On Thursday, the CJEU press service told PAP the case is at the written stage now when both the European Commission and the Polish government present their arguments in writing.
For the time being, it is not known when the oral procedure is to start, meaning the hearing of the parties and a possible trial.
Up to more than ten months are required to make an appeal against the announced decision.
"Such proceedings take one year on average", an informer in the Court of Justice in Luxembourg told PAP.
How to dress a baby for a baptism?
Here are some practical tips.
Baptism is an exceptionally important celebration in the life of the toddler and its parents.
It is very often the first occasion at which the whole family gathers around the baby to celebrate her/him.
No wonder that the new mom and dad want their child to look perfect on this day.
Before you make a final decision about what your child will wear make up your mind if it would be comfortable.
Shops are full of elegant costumes that will stop your baby from feeling comfortable.
What should you consider?
The first criterion of choosing the baptism dress is the child's age.
It was not until recently that toddlers who were just several weeks old were baptized in white sets, lying in the same cradles or huge pillows.
Nowadays it is often older children who get baptized: they may be several months, one year old or even older.
It is quite obvious that such a big child would need another baptism costume.
If your child is baptized at the age of 3–4 months, she/he will probably stay in a baby carriage or on the hands of its parents or godparents.
It is best to choose comfortable, cotton sleepers or costumes.
Even though these clothes are often considered to be rather casual, you just need to find some festive variants, for example with frills or lacing.
An ideal solution for a boy is a bodysuit with an imprinted bow-tie and braces.
In case of older children you can allow yourself for more fantasy.
A girl will look beautiful in a simple, tulle dress.
Many parents of girls would like their kids to wear richly ornamented, frilly baptism dresses, combined with coats, bands and caps.
Unfortunately, many manufacturers use artificial, non-breathing materials that does not prove comfortable for the child.
Trying to find an appropriate costume is worth visiting the Asanti for Kids shop, offering cotton-based, elegant costumes.
Delicate, tulle skirts, satin dresses, lances, appliques and cute sets will make your daughter look beautiful and feel comfortable.
An ideal outfit for a young gentleman: cotton suit.
It was not until recently that the parents of boys preferred the suits resembling the "adult models".
Polyester jackets and trousers, stiff collars or caps often made young elegant boys show their dissatisfaction.
Quite luckily, now they were replaced by comfortable cotton costumes.
You just need to have a look at the sets available at Asanti for Kids, namely soft, tracksuit shorts and a blouse with a front vest-like pattern.
Those costumes look very elegant and at the same time do not constrain the movements of the toddler who is discovering the world.
Krystyna Pawłowicz published her declaration of assets
Krystyna Pawłowicz submitted her declaration of assets at the end of the term.

As a reminder, Pawłowicz announced her departure from politics.
As her terms comes to an end, she has PLN 110 thousand in the bank.
As indicated in the statement submitted by the MP, she receives a pension of PLN 4,7 thousand.
Pawłowicz has a flat worth PLN 570 thousand and another, smaller one, which she rents out for PLN 880 thousand per month.

The voting about the adjournment of session for the duration of the conference held by the Conservative Party.

British Members of Parliament voted against a three days adjournment of House of Commons session for the duration of the annual programme conference held by the Conservative Party, which was requested by the government.
289 members were in favour of this idea, whereas 306 voted against it.
Normally, House of Commons stops its sessions for the duration of party conferences so that members of parliament do not have to resign from the participation in them and in the sessions.
However, the opposition parties decided that the Parliament should not stop the session in such a key time, namely in the last weeks before Brexit that is scheduled for 31st October.
The government motion to make a pause in the session was supported by 289 Members of Parliament, whereas 306 were against it.
Two opposition parties already held their conferences

The fact that the request for a break was refused can be perceived as a political revenge of the opposition aimed at the Prime Minister Boris Johnson because of his decision to suspend the parliament for five weeks (on Friday the Supreme Court found it unlawful and considered as null and void) as well as because of the fact that after the judge decision he is not eager to apologize for it.
After this decision the House of Commons resumed its sessions on Wednesday, the most important event of the day was Johnson's speech and a heated debate afterwards.
Johnson blamed the opposition of blocking Brexit and avoiding earlier elections.
"It is high time to proceed with Brexit.
We need to do it to respect the results of referendum.
Brexit must come so that we can deal with our citizen priorities, with health care and costs of living.
Brexit must come so that we can unite this country", said Johnson.
The conference of the Conservative Party is to begin in Manchester on the coming Sunday and last until Wednesday, 2nd October.
The conferences of the two main opposition parties, the Labour Party and Liberal Democrats, were already held.
One of the justification for such a long parliament suspension given by Johnson were party conferences.
Media: Andrzej Duda blames Israel for anti-Semitic attacks on Poland
"President Andrzej Duda believes that the anti-Semitic attacks in Poland are the reaction to the anti-Polish rhetoric of Israeli leaders," foreign media report.
The president’s spokesperson firmly demented these reports.
"It is simply not true," Błażej Spychalski wrote on Twitter.

Israeli media, including Haaretz and Jerusalem Post, cite the Jewish Insider in writing that, during his meeting at the Polish embassy in New York, Andrzej Duda stated that Israel is responsible for the latest anti-Semitic attacks in Poland.
The president said that the anti-Polish rhetoric of Israeli leaders is to be blamed for the increase of the number of anti-Semitic attacks in Poland.
He was referring to the words of Israeli Minister of Foreign Affairs Israel Katz who stated back in February that "Poles suckled anti-Semitism with their mothers’ milk".
Andrzej Duda said it is a pity that Israel Katz did not apologise for the embarrassing words of his politicians.
He also mentioned the act of aggression against Polish ambassador in Israel, Marek Magierowski.
He was attacked in May by an aggressor who shouted: "Pole, Pole".
"Not only is the quote inaccurate.
It is simply not true," Błażej Spychalski wrote on Twitter.
He stressed that Duda "never said Israel was responsible for the recent anti-Semitic attacks in Poland."
Spychalski said the portal "made this up."

According to "Jl" sources, during the meeting a dispute occurred as well between Holocaust survivor Edward Mosberg, awarded with the Commander’s Cross of the Order of Merit of the Republic of Poland, and rabbi Shmuley Boteach.
Mosberg allegedly agreed with President Duda’s words by saying that Jews from Israel "like Katz" are responsible for the rise of anti-Semitism.
According to the portal’s sources, Boteach allegedly interrupted Mosberg’s statement.
Who is Banaś and what is his guilt?
The tenement house rented by pimps let the journalist discover some negligences in the financial statements by Marian Banaś.
Here is the summary of another affair that was a major shock for the ruling party.

The journalists of "Superwizjer" TVN revealed that Marian Banaś, head of the Supreme Audit Office has not been mentioning the 400 metres tenement house in Krakow's district Podgórze in his financial statement during the recent years.
What is more, the subtenant is said to have run a brothel there (to rent rooms per hours).
The building itself was allegedly a security for the repayment of the credit from 2016 onwards.
It was Bertold Kittel who noticed the irregularities in the programme "Superwizjer".
The journalist revealed that the tenement house of Banaś was rented by those linked with the criminal world to use it as a spot for "erotic meetings".
The customers were probably the men using prostitutes.
Banaś's response to the allegations was vague and unclear.
What is interesting, the tenement house rented by pimps let the journalist discover some negligences in the financial statements by Marian Banaś.
The tenement house itself was described quite vaguely and the income from its rental was lowered.
"The fortune of Marian Banaś and his wife may be between PLN 6 and 8 million.
The couple benefits from two houses, three flats as well as savings[...]", says Money.pl.
As analysed by the portal, the tenement house of Banaś itself was worth about PLN 3 million.
Central Anticorruption Bureau has been currently investigating the property statement of Marian Banaś for the years 2015–2019.
Banaś said he would suspend his work at SAO until it is finished. "I will file a motion to be granted unpaid holidays to the Marshall", he assured.
Opposition demands explanation
"There is no information that the CBA extended its investigation or accelerated checking the property statements issued by Marian Banaś.
That is why we are forced to act instead of the country bodies and file a :notification on suspicion of committing a crime, said PO-KO member of Parliament, Mariusz Witczak.

"If an ordinary Pole estimated the rental incomes of their real estates at such an extremely low level, they would be controlled 10 times, they would have a surcharge and face financial penalty proceedings, he added.
He raised to fall
Marian Banaś is the new head of Supreme Audit Office.
He was appointed to this position on 30th August 2019, for a 6 years term of office.
He was chosen to be the candidate of Prawo i Sprawiedliwość and accepted for this position thanks to the votes of this party.
In the past Banaś worked at SAO in the years 1992–2005, collaborating with Lech Kaczyński.
During the first term of office by PiS (2005–2008) Banaś was the head of Customs Service as well as held the position of under-secretary of state at the Ministry of Finance.
In 2015 he was chosen to be the head of Customs Service again and in 2017 he became in charge of the National Tax Administration.
He also used to be the Finance Minister in the government of Mateusz Morawiecki.
Cooler Master releases a new graphics card holder
Graphics cards can weigh a lot these days, which naturally makes room for a new category of products, which would not be seen on store shelves a decade ago.
Such solution – the ELV8 RG8 graphics card holder – was presented by Cooler Master.
The new model of the graphics card holder is not only a functional solution that allows for a better grip on the graphics card without having to rely solely on the PCI-express slot load.
Cooler Master ELV8 RGB plays an additional, decorative role.
"Rzeczpospolita": Ignoring Policeman’s Command will be Penalized
According to the daily, neglecting the order of specific conduct given by a policeman is to be a new offence type, likely to result in a fine, detention or restriction of personal liberty.
The introduction of such a change is requested by the Police trade union activists.
The idea was brought to the Sejm Petition Committee.
"It is serious as more than one half a million minor offence cases reach Polish court every year now", we read.
Rzeczpospolita found out the petition written by the Independent Trade Union of Policemen concerning the amendment of the Petty Offence Code is likely to succeed.
The petition authors propose a new wording of Article 54a of the Petty Offence Code.

It is to read: "Whoever does not comply with the request or order of a public officer given within and pursuant to the Act provisions shall be subject to the penalty of detention, fine or restriction of personal liberty".
"Paragraph 3 of that provision mentions an identical penalty for the people who, not complying with the orders, prevent or hamper performance of an official duty", the daily says.

Sociologist Andrzej Kowalski told Rzeczpospolita that although he agrees with the core message of the proposed provision, he is afraid that if it is implemented, it can be used for political manifestations.
"This would not be good for liberation demonstration and instead of soothing the situation, it would inflame it", he adds.

According to the statistics quoted by the daily, 86 percent of citizens had a positive opinion about the Police interventions in 2018, and the services intervene 1.5 million times in the city each time.
Buras is worried about Europe.
Jáchym Topol has writing in his blood.
His ancestors were editors, translators and writers.
His father, Josef Topol, was one of the most important post-war Czech playwrights, today ranking among Václav Havel.
Jáchym has been predestined because of his talent from the very beginning and he is trying to make use of it.
After eight years he is back with "A sensitive person".
It is a story about Buras and Soňa as well as their two sons who are, however, not a typical Czech family.
They are wandering actors travelling across Europe.
He is a Shakespeare lover and a thief, she is a one-eyed translator who loves wine.
One of the boys never uttered any sound, for the other time stopped in his toddler times.
However, it is not the protagonists who are most important in this book.
All of them are just a background for observing the world in which there is no place left for artist nomads.
It is the world of a filthy countryside, a society of old, distrustful people and promiscuous youth.
"A sensitive person" tends to turn into a theatre full of absurd.
The narration mirrors the stage directions and the dialogues of the protagonists create this world.
The stage is Europe, full of worries about its future, but also full of questions about its past.
Belgium: Brussels Airlines Cancelled 105 Flights Because of Thomas Cook Bankruptcy
Although the British Travel Agency, Thomas Cook, went bankrupt, its Belgian branch office Neckermann still operates.
However, the company has problems.
According to VRT television, Brussels Airlines announced they would cancel 105 flights in October because of their problems connected with Thomas Cook bankruptcy.
Also, Neckermann dismissed 75 employees.
All the trips booked in Belgium with this agency will be cancelled but the tourists will be able to get their money back.
The court in Ghent announced also bankruptcy of three Belgian daughter companies, i.e. Thomas Cook Belgium, Thomas Cook Retail and Thomas Cook Financial Services.
At present there are ca. 12 thousand Belgians staying abroad on trips bought in Thomas Cook.
Another 40 thousand were to go with the agency by the end of the year.

On Monday, the spokeswomen for Thomas Cook Belgium, Leen Segers, said the company is "fully operable" now although the British parent company announced its bankruptcy which caused anxiety of employees and customers.
Then, the branch office reassured the customers who bought their trips in it would go for holiday.
Thomas Cook, the oldest and one of the largest travel agencies worldwide, announced its bankruptcy at night from Sunday to Monday.
The direct cause of bankruptcy was the Sunday crash of the last-chance negotiations with creditors and prospective investors.

The creditors demanded that the company should acquire extra 200 million pounds, besides the rescue plan agreed in August worth 900 million pounds, as security for winter season when the turnovers of travel agencies are usually lower.
However, the company problems had been accumulating for several years resulting in a debt of 1.6 billion pounds.

Görlitz in Germany offering free accommodation in exchange for feedback
Free accommodation in exchange for feedback – such an extraordinary offer awaits travellers in the German city Görlitz.
The action is aimed at combating the decreasing number of citizens.
Görlitz is Germany's most eastern city.
Beautiful pastel old city attracts 140 thousand tourists annually.
However, as "The Guardian" reports, the city has been facing major problems.
Görlitz has the lowest salaries in Germany.
The city is also facing a constant decrease of citizen number.
After the Berlin wall fell in 1989 most of them emigrated to the west of the country, which is why the city population decreased by 25 percent.
In 2013 it amounted to 54 thousand people.
In their attempt to combat depopulation the clerks came across an idea of offering free monthly accommodation in the city.
As for now, they have received 150 applications.
Two thirds of them were filed by the inhabitants of big cities.
It is also the citizens of Hungary, Czech Republic, United States and Great Britain who are interested in the programme.
"When we filed our application, we thought the programme was meant to talk the people into moving to Görlitz", said one of the project participants.
"Now we feel it doesn't matter if we stay here after four weeks or not", he added.
There are seven thousand free flats in the city and the unemployment rate is three times as high as the average in the whole country.
Even though the city authorities hope some would stay there forever, the main goal of the programme is to collect the opinion of the participants.
The information from surveys and questionnaires are aimed to revitalize smaller German cities.
"We want to find out more about what people need and if they decide to move, what is the reason for it", said Robert Knippschild who is in charge of the programme.
Other cities have already tried to attract new citizens, offering them free accommodation.
The first one to do so was Detroit that launched a program of financing young aspiring specialists for living and working in the city for one year.
Nowadays such solutions are a commonplace in many destinations, from the Greek island Antikythera to Candela in Italy or in the US city Tulsa (Oklahoma).
